title: C.I.A. Conducted Drone Strike on Port in Venezuela
summary: The attack last week, on a dock purportedly used for shipping narcotics, did not kill anyone, people briefed on the operation said. But it was the first known U.S. operation inside Venezuela.

title: U.S. Kills 2 in Strike in Pacific, as Trump Pressures Venezuela
summary: The attack was the 30th announced by the U.S. military since early September. It came days after President Trump said the U.S. had struck a coastal site related to drugs and Venezuela.

title: C.I.A. Strikes Inside Venezuela, and U.S. Tells U.N. Agencies to ‘Adapt, Shrink or Die’
summary: Plus, the mountain climbing brothers trying to rewrite the world’s maps.

title: New Year’s Eve Concerts at Kennedy Center Are Canceled
summary: The jazz drummer Billy Hart said the decision was “evidently” connected to President Trump’s name being added to the arts center.

title: Trump, Pressing Ahead on Ukraine-Russia Talks, Confronts Difficult Realities
summary: The U.S.-led negotiations have made some progress, but still face fundamental challenges, including over security guarantees to counter future Russian aggression.

title: The Cover-Up: Inside the Plot to Conceal Assad’s Crimes
summary: Thousands of documents and interviews with Assad-era officials reveal how the regime worked to conceal evidence of its atrocities during the Syrian civil war.

title: How the Assad Regime Covered Up Its Crimes: Key Takeaways
summary: We documented how the dictator Bashar al-Assad and his henchmen conspired to hide evidence of torture and deaths of detainees during Syria’s long civil war.

title: China Fires Rockets Near Taiwan in Display of Military Power
summary: China’s military also sent warships and aircraft during a second day of exercises designed to show its ability to claim the democratic island.

title: Yonaguni, the Japanese Island on the Front Lines of China’s Feud with Japan
summary: Yonaguni, a tiny Japanese island near Taiwan, is getting soldiers, radar and missiles. As China’s dispute with Tokyo escalates, some residents are worried.

title: Gone in 2025: A Yearlong Procession of Giants
summary: Marquee names all, they found international fame in the arts, politics, the sciences and beyond.

title: George and Amal Clooney Become French Citizens
summary: Mr. Clooney, who owns a farmhouse in France, has said that living there enabled him and his wife, a human rights lawyer, to pursue a quieter existence with their children.

title: Trump and Netanyahu Praise Each Other After Meeting, Despite Differences Over Gaza
summary: The American and Israeli leaders showed few signs of disagreement after meeting in Florida, giving no public indication of their growing strains over Gaza, Syria and other issues.

title: Saudis Say Airstrike in Yemen Targeted Arms From U.A.E.
summary: The Saudi-led coalition said a strike on a port in southern Yemen was targeting weapons bound for a separatist group that is backed by the United Arab Emirates.

title: Katherine Maher of NPR Has Come Out on Top Despite Battles With Trump and the CPB
summary: Katherine Maher has taken an unyielding approach to NPR’s biggest battles — which has sometimes put her at odds with her colleagues in public media.

title: Mamdani Promised Universal Child Care. How Long Could It Take?
summary: Here is what to expect if you’re expecting relief from the soaring cost of day care in New York City.

title: Mamdani Will Be Sworn In at Abandoned Subway Station Beneath City Hall
summary: Hours before Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani holds an inauguration block party outside City Hall, he will officially become mayor in a small private ceremony.

title: How a Research Trip to Antarctica Deals With Time Zones
summary: The clocks aboard our icebreaker will be changed several times en route to Antarctica. It’s one of many things that make the expedition feel otherworldly.

title: Can a Corporation Be Complicit in War Crimes? Sweden Is Trying to Find Out.
summary: It’s Sweden’s longest criminal trial. I was there because of a different historic distinction.

title: Overlooked Stories
summary: We look at some of our best stories from 2025 that Times editors thought deserved more attention.

title: Khaleda Zia, Bangladesh’s First Female Prime Minister, Dies
summary: In office for three terms, she traded the country’s leadership with Sheikh Hasina, the head of another political dynasty, over decades. She was believed to be 80.

title: K-Pop Group NewJeans Faces New Uncertainty After Member Is Dropped
summary: The band’s label said it had dropped one of the girl group’s five members. NewJeans’s legal battle has drawn public scrutiny of the K-pop industry.

title: Did Starmer Impose a Curfew in the U.K.? No, It’s a Fake TikTok Video.
summary: A.I. has made it easy to put words in people’s mouths, and Prime Minister Keir Starmer of Britain has become a favorite target. The motive, experts say, is not political but financial.

title: Hundreds Sue Virginia Hospital and Executives Over Unneeded Surgeries
summary: More than 500 women claimed that they had received unnecessary operations. Hospital leaders said they were not aware of a doctor’s misconduct.
